intro: Dyschoriste angusta, commonly known as narrowleaf dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters and attracting various pollinators.
